result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kim K. Wood

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 10:31am 
Defendant Kim K. Wood in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Kim K. Wood.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 

Resolution contemplates prepayment of restitution; Atty Crawford requests additional status be scheduled. 
--no objection from ADA Teuber 
recess: 10:35am 
NEXT: Status on 11/15/22 at 2:30pm
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:47am. 
Defendant Kim K. Wood appears by phone. Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds the audio-connection to be sound sufficient. 
Attorney Crawford indicates that he had a pretrial conference and that parties are working toward a plea agreement; this would require Ms. Wood to pay the approximately $2,000 restitution amount up front.  The scheduling of another status conference is requested. 
recess 11:50am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on September 16th at 10:30am
Unless to do so would be against medical orders, she should appear by telephone
Letter Requesting Waiver of Appearance of Defendant

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:32am 
Defendant Kim K. Wood in court with Attorney Paul S. Crawford.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy N. Olszewski- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Crawford  
--redirect examination by DA Hall 
The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Wood committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.
Closing arguments are given by counsel. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 11:51am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on July 13th at 10:40am--only counsel need to appear, (2) Status Conference on July 28th at 11:30am
OK to reschedule

records.addlTxt: Attorney Crawford
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

--not to discuss the case with co-defendant or Victim 1 outside the presence of counsel
--not to use or possess any financial documents other than her own
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 08:43 AM Defendant Kim K. Wood in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant or Victim 1 outside the presence of counsel
--not to use or possess any financial documents other than her own
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 8:47 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 6/3/22 at 8:30 am
